briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Ustekinumab Re-induction Therapy in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease
officialTitle: A Phase 3b, Randomized, Double-blind, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous Re-induction Therapy With Ustekinumab in Patients With Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease
summary: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a single intravenous (IV) re-induction dose of approximately 6 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) ustekinumab in participants with secondary loss of response (LoR) to subcutaneous (SC) every 8 Weeks (q8w) 90 mg ustekinumab maintenance therapy.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Response at Week 16
